thread.title: Trump says CNBC agrees to limit debate to two hours
thread.title_full: Trump says CNBC agrees to limit debate to two hours - POLITICO

author: Nick Gass
title: Trump says CNBC agrees to limit debate to two hours
text:
The next Republican debate on CNBC will be two hours, Donald Trump said Friday morning, a day after the candidate's campaign threatened to reconsider its participation in the Oct. 28 event in Boulder, Colorado. ".@CNBC has just agreed that the debate will be TWO HOURS. Fantastic news for all, especially the millions of people who will be watching!" the Republican presidential candidate tweeted.
The network declined to comment.
The message comes following two days of contentious campaign calls with the network over the debate rules, including one on Thursday during which Trump campaign manager Corey Lewandowski said that if the debate did not include opening and closing statements and ran more than two hours, Trump would have to think again about showing up. The campaign of Ben Carson, who is running close to even or in second to Trump in many polls, also indicated that it would pull out on the same grounds.
Trump had aired his grievances with the network in several tweets Thursday:
The @GOP should not agree to the ridiculous debate terms that @CNBC is asking unless there is a major benefit to the party.
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 15, 2015
. @CNBC is pushing the @GOP around by asking for extra time (and no criteria) in order to sell more commercials.
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 15, 2015
Why is the @GOP being asked to do a debate that is so much longer than the just-aired and very boring #DemDebate ?
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) October 15, 2015
Hadas Gold contributed to this report.
